title: @Riot, Can we get more Support champs in 2017?

replies.body: We intend to release a champion this year who should work well in a traditional support playstyle (focus on helping allies/hindering enemies rather than damage, works well in a duo lane).

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Nhb4rxXA,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2017-02-16T04:24:25.109+0000)
>
> We intend to release a champion this year who should work well in a traditional support playstyle (focus on helping allies/hindering enemies rather than damage, works well in a duo lane).

This comment gives me bad vibes... Guess we'll have to wait till 2018
Bad vibes? How so?

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Nhb4rxXA,comment-id=000700000000,timestamp=2017-02-16T05:22:39.698+0000)
>
> Bad vibes? How so?

Well every support after braum has pretty much been terrible.. You said the new support champion *SHOULD* work bot.  But you haven't classified the new champion as a support. All you say is it SHOULD work. Which makes me believe the champion wont be created for the role. As a support main i would love to have more support champs. Having one champion that MIGHT be a support once every year really sucks, when other roles get 2-3 a year.

My phrasing there's to distinguish between the support position and what many players refer to as supports (the buff/heal giving types we refer to internally as enchanters). I certainly think the champ in question will get play primarily in in duo lanes and be most effective with an ally to lane with.

I have an issue with the diversity of the support role currently.  It is possible for nearly all champions to be played in the support role, but it is very difficult for those of us who enjoy some of the more traditional supports to take those champions into other lanes, as they get nerfed swiftly. 

What is the recourse for those of us who enjoy this type of champion in an age where anyone can take champions designed for AP carry and play them support at a greater effect?

She can't jungle. She can't go top. She can't go mid. She can't adc. 

Support Slave.
An ability "Heal" which cannot be used on self. LUL. 
Useless passive.

Oh god don't even get me started {{champion:43}} 
Broke her limbs and also broke a legitimately fun and unique kit to turn her into a generic battlemage.
Then snapped her neck in patch 5.10 and turned her into a shield bot. 
Then Meddler and every other member of the balancing and design avoid ANYTHING pertaining to her rework.

Tbh I'd be happy to at least see Riot release a post that speaks about failed reworks, and have them acknowledge that they seriously messed up such a great champion.
Didn't they already do that when they admitted they messed up on kog and then reverted him?

They've said similar things about Skarner at the very least, though minus the revert, and possibly Morde. Personally, I think Karma is a lot of fun to play Bot OR Mid, but I never played her pre-rework, so maybe I'm biased.

You are not biased. Anyone who is looking at old Karma as good is looking through rose-colored glasses. She was a joke until her rework and you would get flamed for even hovering her. Her kit was not interesting or even remotely cohesive and she would be just as bad now as she was then if she were to be reverted.

I played back then, and she was considered to be one of the strongest late game supports. The only part of her that made her nonviable wasn't her kit. Her passive was considered anywhere between the 2nd to top 10 depending on what site you looked at. it was her mana regen/ cost of her spells that made people rage people for playing her. Unless you insta killed Karma quickly went oom and became a super minion. That and it was easy for her to take cs with her support skills if she was careless, but thats a player awareness problem not a champ problem. I jungled her back when only junglers like noc or fiddles took blue lvl 1 without a leash, and karma could do it, but even with the blue buff, she would run out of mana on wolves, the second camp. Her mana pool was stupid nonviable early game. Also I don't know why you say her kit is uninteresting or non cohesive. Its more cohesive than the current kit. Her q went from a damage ability with a mantra'd heal to a damage ability with a mantra'd nuke. her shield went from the strongest in the game to one that is mostly utility unless mantra'd. Her link, while offering some small utility, now is there for her survive ability mantra'd. The old leash was a speed buff/debuff for all who crossed the leash and the leashed targets, and only did damage if it hit an enemy who wasn't a leashed target. Much more utility oriented. The new karma's kit feels so much less like a support and instead a weird hybrid of support/carry that I feel isn't enough of either to be effect after lane, though I have definitely seen it work so I realize that it is just my opinion. All being said, I was never a karma main, but she was my favorite niche support and I would love to see the old one back. I'm sure every reworked champ has fans of the old version that still shed a tear for the glory days.

idk man karma tahm and nami are above any of those right now and champions like soraka sona lulu janna and bard are all quite effective, to be honest the support position is the most diverse role in the game right now since all the champions are almost perfectly balanced (if the zyra and malzahar nerfs have impacted them, they were a bit too oppresive before

My point there was that in a match-up against any of those four, the lane favor is pretty clear.

You must be joking if you think the Support role is anymore balanced then any other role in the game. 
It is literally the biggest fallout of champiions in the game. The Support role is given to whatever champions are forced there. 

My main point was that any time a support, specifically an enchanter type support, is viable in a different lane, Riot will break their legs, arms and neck to push them back into bot lane, no matter what it breaks in their kits, no matter whether they fit the meta or not. 

Lulu was loved Mid and Top lane a long time after release, but Riot decided to force her bot lane and into unviability for the longest time. There were other options to balancing her for solo and duo lanes, but Riot decided to gut her decide. 
Whereas Ziggs is allowed to play ADC and still retain a 54% win rate. 

Nami is hardly a solid choice, and only sits as a pocket pick. Tahm is pretty garbage tbh, and Karma's kit is gimped and mediocre since the nerfs.

The Support role really isn't that diverse, AP Damage supports are the primary go to, Enchanters are somewhat useful until GW is built, and then Tank supports are honestly useless because of the first aformentioned supports.
Wait, Lulu was loved mid and top? You have got to be kidding me..She was the lamest shit and professional teams were forced to pick or ban her for nearly a season lol.

What i would like to see is a Debuff based Champion thats more dedicated to hindering enemies damage/cc/mobility/resistances as a whole.

Kinda like the polar opposite to Sona/Raka in a way.

Heres just some stupid ideas to get the jist of what i mean.

Places a "Mirror Shield" on an ally, whoever hits this ally, will do damage normally, but any status effects (slow, stun, taunt, fear, charm, etc) is applied to whoever hit it.

Shoots an AoE similar to Morgs pool, does slight damage burn, but reduces targets AP ratios for x amount of seconds, scales on level.

Adds a shield to Ally, whoever hits it, gets reduced AD for x amount of seconds, scales on level. 

I mean im no creative on the spot kinda guy, otherwise id be applying for a job there. 

(someones gonna comment saying good thing i dont cause my ideas are crap lol).

Hm, if I'm reading behind the lines right... this champion might not necessarily be a *carry,* but could pair up with a traditional support and wreck bot lane. A counter to the traditional ADC+Support duo lane, akin to the Mordekaiser update (that... didn't really exceed expectations, but I digress). Like a more defensive bot laner that keeps the enemy lane from snowballing out of control...

Just speculation, based off how intentionally vague you're being and the past attempt(s) at changing up bot lane. I'm probably far off the mark, but if I'm right I deserve a cookie.
You realise he literally said it was a support.. Nothing to do with the 'carry' position in bot lane.

Perhaps he fears, as i possibly do, a Thresh-effect, where the new support might have a kit with just enough CC + ally protection to dominate the supp meta. Then the nerfs come later on.

Obviously the champion team doesn't intend for it but the absolutely wide (and deep) possibility of game states in the botlane expresses that the dynamic of the new champion's mechanics cannot be reasonably foreseen. This may cause a disruption in an otherwise viable roster of support champions. Nobody liked when thresh was p/b because he could nearly do everything (back in the day) that any other supp could do. Naturally, he was nerfed afterwards with a few numbers and kit shifting, and all was well. 

On another note, Meddler, won't the reworked Galio be able to fill in a support role? In my opinion, he naturally would be; as his aesthetic and thematic point towards a protector or similar (this is on the basis that his core narrative pillars haven't changed too much).

Honestly I feel thresh is the big unsung success story in support role champion design. years later he's still the single most popular pick in the support position and that's simply because he's got a kit that doesn't shoehorn him into any specific function and is also good enough in the general case and also has it's own unique cool stuff. 

Overall I'd rather be playing "the Yasuo of support role" than a Soraka.  

I mean: at this point in time it's a lot better for me specifically, as a support player, to get an overloaded over-tooled champion that's going to require a hellish balancing stage, than another 4-simple-skills braum. 

because right now, I am waiting for something awesome. I've got cool champions, I've got champions with heart. What I am missing is a pure bullshit champion... something that every other lane has.
